metadata.titleEn: A combined Terra and Aqua MODIS land surface temperature and meteorological station data product for China (2003-2017)
metadata.description:
Land surface temperature (LST) is a key variable for high temperature and drought monitoring and
climate and ecological environment research. Due to the sparse distribution of ground observation stations, thermal infrared remote sensing technology has become an important means of quickly obtaining ground temperature over large areas. However, there are many missing and low-quality values in satellite-based LST data because clouds cover more than 60% of the global surface every day. This article presents a unique LST dataset with a monthly temporal resolution for China from 2003 to 2017 that makes full use of the advantages of MODIS data and meteorological station data to overcome the defects of cloud influence via a reconstruction model. We specifically describe the reconstruction model, which uses a combination of MODIS daily data, monthly data and meteorological station data to reconstruct the LST in areas with cloud coverage and for grid cells with elevated LST error, and the data performance is then further improved by establishing a regression analysis model. The validation indicates that the new LST dataset is highly consistent with in situ observations. For the six natural subregions with different climatic conditions in China, verification using ground observation data shows that the root mean square error (RMSE) ranges from 1.24 to 1.58 K, the mean absolute error (MAE) varies from 1.23 to 1.37 K and the Pearson coefficient (R2) ranges from 0.93 to 0.99. The new dataset adequately captures the spatiotemporal variations in LST at annual, seasonal and monthly scales. From 2003 to 2017, the overall annual mean LST in China showed a weak increase. Moreover, the positive trend was remarkably unevenly distributed across China. The most significant warming occurred in the central and western areas of the Inner Mongolia Plateau in the Northwest Region, and the average annual temperature change is greater than 0.1K (R>0:71, P<0:05), and a strong negative trend was observed in some parts of the Northeast Region and South China Region. Seasonally, there was significant warming in western China in winter, which was most pronounced in December. The reconstructed dataset exhibits significant improvements and can be used for the spatiotemporal evaluation of LST in high-temperature and drought-monitoring studies.
More detail please refer to Zhao et al (2020). doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3528024
metadata.descriptionCn:
中国地表温度数据集包含2003-2017年期间中国（约960万平方公里土地）的地表温度数据，时间分辨率为月尺度，空间分辨率为5600 m。
数据集主要是通过集成MODIS每日数据（MOD11C1和MYD11C1），月数据（MOD11C3和MYD11C3）和气象站数据，以重建月尺度LST图像云覆盖下的真实LST来生成的，然后构建回归分析模型以进一步提高精度。 六个具有不同气候条件的自然分区。 精度分析表明，重建结果与现场测量结果密切相关，平均RMSE为1.39°C，MAE为1.30°C，R2为0.97。
详情请参考引用文献Zhao et al (2020)。
metadata.instructions:
File name: China's surface temperature data is stored in text format with the name of“ yyyymm.tif ”Where yyyy stands for year and mm stands for month, for example, 200301.tif represents this image file to describe the land surface temperature in China in the first month of 2003.
Data reading mode: the image files in the dataset can be opened by ArcGIS and NDVI. During the reading process, TFW files will be generated, and the displayed TFW files are the text files of TIFF image coordinate information.
metadata.instructionsCn:
文件命名：中国地表温度数据以文本格式存储，文件的名称为“yyyymm.tif”，其中yyyy代表年，mm代表月份，比如200301.tif就代表这个图像文件描述2003年第一月我国的地表温度状况。

数据读取方式：该数据集中的图像文件可用Arcgis和ENVI打开，在读取过程中会生成tfw格式的文件，所显示的tfw文件就是TIFF影像坐标信息的文本文件。

background: Land surface temperature (LST), which is controlled by land–atmosphere interactions and energy fluxes, is an essential parameter for the physical processes of the surface energy balance and water cycle at regional and global scales. LST datasets not only are required for high-temperature and drought research over various spatial scales but also are important elements for improving global hydrological and climate prediction models. LST is measured by meteorological stations which have the advantages of high reliability and long time series. However, the meteorological station data collected as point data with very limited spatial coverage are often sparsely and/or irregularly distributed, especially in remote and rugged areas. In contrast to ground-based observations with their limited availability and discrete spatial information, images captured by satellite thermal infrared instruments have become reliable alternative data sources with the advantages of detailed spatialized surfaces and near-real-time data access. However, satellite-derived LST data are frequently and strongly affected by data gaps and cloud cover, which affect the quality of the LST product. Cloud cover is frequent, and the locations of cloud cover are often uncertain. On average, at any one time, approximately 65 % of the global surface is obscured by clouds, leading directly to missing values over large, unevenly distributed areas in an image.

Cloud cover is frequent, and the locations of cloud cover are often uncertain. On average, at any one time, approximately 65 % of the global surface is obscured by clouds, leading directly to missing values over large, unevenly distributed areas in an image.

dataset: This article presents a unique LST dataset with a monthly temporal resolution for China from 2003 to 2017 that makes full use of the advantages of MODIS data and meteorological station data to overcome the defects of cloud influence via a reconstruction model. The validation indicates that the new LST dataset is highly consistent with in situ observations. For the six natural subregions with different climatic conditions in China, verification using ground observation data shows that the root mean square error (RMSE) ranges from 1.24 to 1.58 °C, the mean absolute error (MAE) varies from 1.23 to 1.37 °C and the Pearson coefficient (R2) ranges from 0.93 to 0.99.
findings: The new dataset adequately captures the spatiotemporal variations in LST at annual, seasonal and monthly scales. From 2003 to 2017, the overall annual mean LST in China showed a weak increase. The most significant warming occurred in the central and western areas of the Inner Mongolia Plateau in the Northwest Region, and the average annual temperature change is greater than 0.1 K (R>0.71, P<0.05), and a strong negative trend was observed in some parts of the Northeast Region and South China Region. Seasonally, there was significant warming in western China in winter, which was most pronounced in December. The reconstructed dataset exhibits significant improvements and can be used for the spatiotemporal evaluation of LST in high-temperature and drought-monitoring studies.
backgroundCn: 地表温度（LST）受陆地-大气相互作用和能量通量的控制，是区域和全球尺度上表面能量平衡和水循环物理过程的重要参数。LST 数据集不仅在高温和干旱研究中对各种空间尺度至关重要，而且是改善全球水文和气候预测模型的重要元素。LST 通过气象站进行测量，具有高可靠性和长期时间序列的优点。然而，气象站收集的数据作为点数据，空间覆盖范围非常有限，尤其是在偏远和崎岖的地区，往往分布稀疏和/或不规则。与有限的可用性和离散的空间信息的地面观测相比，卫星热红外仪器捕获的图像已成为可靠的替代数据源，具有详细的空间化表面和近实时数据访问的优势。然而，卫星衍生的 LST 数据常常受到数据缺失和云层覆盖的强烈影响，这影响了 LST 产品的质量。云层覆盖频繁，云层覆盖的位置往往不确定。平均而言，在任何一个时刻，全球表面约有 65% 被云层遮挡，直接导致图像中大面积、不均匀分布区域的缺失值。
research objectiveCn: 本文呈现了一个独特的中国月度时间分辨率的陆表温度（LST）数据集，涵盖2003年至2017年，充分利用了MODIS数据和气象站数据的优势，通过重建模型克服了云影响的缺陷。
challengesCn: 然而，卫星基于地表温度（LST）数据中存在许多缺失和低质量的值，因为云层每天覆盖全球表面的60%以上。云层覆盖是频繁的，云层覆盖的位置往往不确定。平均而言，在任何一个时刻，全球表面大约有65%被云层遮挡，这直接导致图像中大面积、不均匀分布的缺失值。
methodsCn: 我们具体描述了重建模型，该模型结合了MODIS日数据、月数据和气象站数据，以重建云覆盖区域和LST误差较高的网格单元的地表温度（LST），并通过建立回归分析模型进一步提高数据性能。
datasetCn: 本文呈现了一个独特的中国月度时间分辨率的地表温度（LST）数据集，涵盖2003年至2017年，充分利用了MODIS数据和气象站数据的优势，通过重建模型克服了云影响的缺陷。验证结果表明，新的LST数据集与现场观测高度一致。对于中国六个具有不同气候条件的自然子区域，使用地面观测数据进行验证显示，均方根误差（RMSE）范围为1.24至1.58°C，平均绝对误差（MAE）变化范围为1.23至1.37°C，皮尔逊相关系数（R²）范围为0.93至0.99。
findingsCn: 新的数据集充分捕捉了中国地表温度（LST）在年度、季节和月度尺度上的时空变化。从2003年到2017年，中国的年均LST整体上呈现出微弱的上升趋势。最显著的变暖发生在西北地区的内蒙古高原中部和西部，年均温度变化超过0.1 K（R>0.71，P<0.05），而在东北地区和南方地区的部分地区则观察到强烈的负趋势。从季节上看，冬季西部中国的变暖显著，尤其在12月表现最为明显。重建的数据集显示出显著的改进，可用于高温和干旱监测研究中LST的时空评估。

Verification.QuestionEn: Is the reconstructed LST dataset consistent with in situ observations across different climatic regions in China?
Verification.QuestionCn: 重建的LST数据集在中国不同气候区域与地面观测数据一致吗？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method that addresses challenges in satellite-derived LST data caused by cloud cover?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个数据收集方法的例子，以解决卫星获取的地表温度（LST）数据因云层覆盖而导致的挑战？
Example.AnswerEn: A data collection method involves using a combination of MODIS daily data, monthly data, and meteorological station data to reconstruct the LST in areas with cloud coverage and for grid cells with elevated LST error, further improving data performance by establishing a regression analysis model.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种数据收集方法涉及使用MODIS日数据、月数据和气象站数据，在云覆盖区域和LST误差较高的网格单元中重建地表温度（LST），通过建立回归分析模型进一步提高数据性能。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a dataset that effectively captures spatiotemporal variations in LST across different climatic regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 一个有效捕捉不同气候区域地表温度（LST）时空变化的数据集的例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of such a dataset is one that provides monthly temporal resolution LST data for China from 2003 to 2017, which captures spatiotemporal variations in LST at annual, seasonal, and monthly scales across six natural subregions with different climatic conditions.
Example.AnswerCn: 这样的数据集的一个例子是提供2003年至2017年中国的月度时间分辨率地表温度（LST）数据，捕捉了六个具有不同气候条件的自然子区域在年度、季节和月度尺度上的地表温度时空变化。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is a reconstruction model in the context of land surface temperature (LST) data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在地表温度（LST）数据收集的背景下，重建模型是指用于恢复或重建地表温度分布的数学或统计模型。这些模型通常利用已有的观测数据、遥感数据或其他相关信息，以填补数据缺口或提高数据的空间和时间分辨率。重建模型可以帮助科学家更好地理解地表温度的变化及其对气候和环境的影响。
Definition.AnswerEn: A reconstruction model in the context of LST data collection refers to a method that integrates satellite data, such as MODIS daily and monthly data, with meteorological station data to estimate LST in areas affected by cloud coverage and to improve the quality of LST data in grid cells with significant errors.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在LST数据收集的背景下，重建模型指的是一种方法，它将卫星数据（如MODIS每日和每月数据）与气象站数据结合起来，以估计受云层覆盖影响的区域的地表温度（LST），并改善在存在显著误差的网格单元中的LST数据质量。

Definition.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with cloud cover in the collection of LST data?
Definition.QuestionCn: 与云层覆盖相关的挑战在于收集地表温度（LST）数据。
Definition.AnswerEn: Challenges associated with cloud cover in LST data collection include frequent and uncertain coverage locations, which obscure approximately 65% of the global surface at any time, leading to missing values and low-quality data over large, unevenly distributed areas.
Definition.AnswerCn: 与云层覆盖相关的地表温度（LST）数据收集的挑战包括频繁且不确定的覆盖位置，导致全球表面约65%的区域在任何时候都被遮挡，从而造成缺失值和大面积、不均匀分布的低质量数据。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the challenges of cloud cover impact the quality of LST data differently when using satellite-based observations compared to meteorological station data?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 云层覆盖的挑战在使用卫星观测与气象站数据时，对地表温度（LST）数据质量的影响方式有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Satellite-based LST data are frequently affected by cloud cover, leading to missing values over large areas, whereas meteorological station data, although reliable, have limited spatial coverage and are often sparsely distributed, especially in remote areas.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 卫星基于地表温度（LST）数据常常受到云层覆盖的影响，导致大面积区域出现缺失值，而气象站数据虽然可靠，但空间覆盖有限，尤其是在偏远地区往往分布稀疏。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What methodological approaches can be employed to reconstruct LST data in regions with frequent cloud coverage?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在频繁云覆盖的地区，可以采用哪些方法论方法来重建地表温度（LST）数据？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: A reconstruction model that uses a combination of MODIS daily data, monthly data, and meteorological station data can be employed. The model aims to reconstruct LST in areas with cloud coverage and for grid cells with elevated LST error, which is further improved through regression analysis.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 一个重建模型可以使用MODIS日数据、月数据和气象站数据的组合。该模型旨在重建云覆盖区域的地表温度（LST）以及LST误差较高的网格单元，进一步通过回归分析来改善。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the frequent occurrence of missing and low-quality values in satellite-based LST data?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致卫星基地表温度（LST）数据中频繁出现缺失和低质量值的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The frequent occurrence of cloud cover, which obscures more than 60% of the global surface at any given time, leads to significant data gaps and missing values in satellite-based LST data.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 云层覆盖的频繁出现，在任何给定时间内遮蔽了全球表面超过60%，导致卫星基于地表温度（LST）数据中出现显著的数据缺口和缺失值。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it important to integrate MODIS data with meteorological station data in reconstructing LST datasets?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 将MODIS数据与气象站数据集成在一起，以重建地表温度（LST）数据集是重要的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Integrating MODIS data with meteorological station data helps overcome the defects of cloud influence, as meteorological stations provide reliable point data, whereas MODIS offers spatial coverage. This combination aids in reconstructing LST in cloud-covered areas and improving data accuracy.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 将MODIS数据与气象站数据结合，有助于克服云层影响的缺陷，因为气象站提供可靠的点数据，而MODIS则提供空间覆盖。这种结合有助于重建云覆盖区域的地表温度（LST），并提高数据的准确性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of integrating satellite thermal infrared data with meteorological station data on the accuracy of land surface temperature datasets?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将卫星热红外数据与气象站数据集成对地表温度数据集的准确性可能产生的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating satellite thermal infrared data with meteorological station data can significantly enhance the accuracy of land surface temperature datasets by overcoming limitations such as data gaps and cloud cover. This approach leverages the detailed spatial information from satellites and the high reliability of station data, resulting in datasets that are more consistent with in situ observations, as indicated by a high Pearson coefficient (R2) and low RMSE and MAE values.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将卫星热红外数据与气象站数据相结合，可以显著提高地表温度数据集的准确性，克服数据缺口和云层覆盖等限制。这种方法利用了卫星的详细空间信息和站点数据的高可靠性，从而生成与现场观测更一致的数据集，正如高皮尔逊相关系数（R2）以及低均方根误差（RMSE）和平均绝对误差（MAE）值所表明的。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the reconstruction model's approach to handling cloud-influenced data affect the spatial and temporal resolution of land surface temperature datasets?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 重建模型处理受云影响的数据的方法如何影响地表温度数据集的空间和时间分辨率？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The reconstruction model's approach, which uses a combination of MODIS daily and monthly data with meteorological station data, allows for the reconstruction of land surface temperature in cloud-covered areas. This method improves the spatial and temporal resolution of the datasets by filling in missing values and correcting elevated LST errors, leading to a more precise and continuous representation of spatiotemporal variations in LST.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 重建模型的方法结合了MODIS日数据和月数据与气象站数据，能够在云覆盖区域重建地表温度。该方法通过填补缺失值和修正升高的地表温度误差，提高了数据集的空间和时间分辨率，从而更精确和连续地表示地表温度的时空变化。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary objective of integrating MODIS data with meteorological station data in the construction of a land surface temperature dataset?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 将MODIS数据与气象站数据结合的主要目的是在构建地表温度数据集时提高数据的准确性和可靠性。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objective of integrating MODIS data with meteorological station data is to overcome the defects of cloud influence via a reconstruction model, enabling the creation of a reliable LST dataset with monthly temporal resolution for China from 2003 to 2017.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 整合MODIS数据与气象站数据的主要目的是通过重建模型克服云影响的缺陷，从而为2003年至2017年期间的中国创建一个可靠的月度时间分辨率的地表温度（LST）数据集。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to address the issue of cloud cover when generating satellite-derived land surface temperature data?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在生成卫星衍生的地表温度数据时，解决云层覆盖问题是非常重要的。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Addressing the issue of cloud cover is crucial because clouds frequently obscure more than 60% of the global surface, leading to missing values over large, unevenly distributed areas in satellite-derived LST data. Overcoming this challenge is essential to ensure the quality and reliability of the LST product.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 解决云层覆盖问题至关重要，因为云层通常会遮挡超过60%的全球表面，导致卫星获取的地表温度（LST）数据在大面积、不均匀分布的区域内出现缺失值。克服这一挑战对于确保LST产品的质量和可靠性至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the intended benefits of developing a regression analysis model to enhance the accuracy of reconstructed land surface temperature data?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 开发回归分析模型以提高重建的地表温度数据准确性的预期好处是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The intended benefits of developing a regression analysis model are to further improve the data performance by accurately reconstructing the LST in areas with cloud coverage and for grid cells with elevated LST error, thereby achieving high consistency with in situ observations and capturing spatiotemporal variations effectively.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 开发回归分析模型的预期好处是通过准确重建云覆盖区域的地表温度（LST）和高地表温度误差的网格单元，进一步提高数据性能，从而实现与现场观测的一致性，并有效捕捉时空变化。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is the regression analysis model constructed and applied to improve the accuracy of land surface temperature datasets?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 回归分析模型是如何构建和应用于提高地表温度数据集的准确性的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The regression analysis model is constructed to further improve the accuracy of the land surface temperature datasets by analyzing and correcting errors in the reconstructed data. This model helps in refining the dataset to ensure higher consistency with in situ observations, as indicated by validation metrics such as RMSE, MAE, and Pearson coefficient.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 回归分析模型的构建旨在通过分析和修正重建数据中的错误，进一步提高地表温度数据集的准确性。该模型有助于优化数据集，以确保与现场观测数据的一致性更高，验证指标如均方根误差（RMSE）、平均绝对误差（MAE）和皮尔逊相关系数均表明了这一点。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the steps involved in validating the reconstructed land surface temperature data against in situ observations across different climatic regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 验证重建的地表温度数据与不同气候区域的现场观测数据之间的步骤包括：
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Validation involves comparing the reconstructed land surface temperature data with ground observation data across six natural subregions with different climatic conditions in China. This process assesses the dataset's accuracy by calculating metrics like root mean square error (RMSE), mean absolute error (MAE), and Pearson coefficient (R2), ensuring that the reconstructed data aligns closely with actual temperature measurements.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 验证涉及将重建的地表温度数据与中国六个不同气候条件的自然子区域的地面观测数据进行比较。这个过程通过计算均方根误差（RMSE）、平均绝对误差（MAE）和皮尔逊相关系数（R2）等指标来评估数据集的准确性，确保重建的数据与实际温度测量值紧密对齐。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What techniques enable the reconstruction of land surface temperature data in areas with frequent cloud cover?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术可以在频繁云层覆盖的地区重建地表温度数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: A reconstruction model that integrates MODIS daily and monthly data with meteorological station data is used to reconstruct land surface temperature in areas with cloud coverage and improve data quality through regression analysis.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 一个重建模型将MODIS日数据和月数据与气象站数据结合，用于在有云覆盖的地区重建地表温度，并通过回归分析提高数据质量。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do satellite-derived data and meteorological station data complement each other in creating a reliable land surface temperature dataset?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 卫星获取的数据和气象站数据在创建可靠的地表温度数据集方面是如何相辅相成的？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Satellite-derived data provide detailed spatialized surfaces and near-real-time access, while meteorological station data offer high reliability and long time series. Their integration helps overcome data gaps caused by cloud cover to create a reliable land surface temperature dataset.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 卫星衍生数据提供详细的空间表面和近实时访问，而气象站数据则提供高可靠性和长期时间序列。它们的结合有助于克服由于云层覆盖造成的数据缺口，从而创建可靠的地表温度数据集。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why are satellite-derived datasets often expected to have missing values due to cloud cover, and how can these gaps be addressed in data collection?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 卫星衍生的数据集通常因为云层覆盖而预期会有缺失值，这些缺口可以通过数据收集中的一些方法来解决。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Satellite-derived datasets are frequently affected by data gaps and cloud cover because clouds obscure approximately 65% of the global surface at any given time. These gaps can be addressed by using a reconstruction model that combines satellite data with ground-based meteorological station data to estimate the land surface temperature in cloud-covered areas.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 卫星衍生的数据集常常受到数据缺口和云层覆盖的影响，因为云层在任何给定时间大约遮蔽了全球表面的65%。这些缺口可以通过使用重建模型来解决，该模型结合了卫星数据和地面气象站数据，以估算云覆盖区域的地表温度。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the anticipated challenges in achieving accurate land surface temperature measurements over various climatic regions, and how can these be mitigated through data collection strategies?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在不同气候区域实现准确的地表温度测量所面临的预期挑战，以及如何通过数据收集策略来缓解这些挑战。
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges in achieving accurate land surface temperature measurements include the variability of climatic conditions and the limitations of point data from meteorological stations. These challenges can be mitigated by integrating satellite data with meteorological station data and using regression analysis models to improve the precision of measurements across different climatic regions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 实现准确的地表温度测量面临的挑战包括气候条件的变化性和气象站点点数据的局限性。这些挑战可以通过将卫星数据与气象站点数据相结合，并使用回归分析模型来提高不同气候区域测量的精确度。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is the reconstruction of land surface temperature datasets important for understanding spatiotemporal variations, and what methods improve their reliability?
Expectation.QuestionCn:
重建地表温度数据集对于理解时空变化的重要性在于，它能够提供更准确的气候变化信息和区域气候特征。通过分析这些数据集，研究人员可以识别出不同地区和时间段的温度变化趋势，从而更好地理解气候系统的动态。

为了提高地表温度数据集的可靠性，可以采用多种方法，包括：

1. 数据同化技术：将观测数据与模型预测结合，以提高温度估计的准确性。
2. 空间插值方法：使用地理信息系统（GIS）技术，通过已知点的数据推测未知区域的温度。
3. 统计回归分析：利用历史数据建立模型，预测未来的温度变化。
4. 机器学习算法：应用先进的算法处理大数据集，以识别复杂的温度模式和趋势。

这些方法的结合能够有效提升地表温度数据集的质量，从而为气候研究提供更可靠的基础。
Expectation.AnswerEn: The reconstruction of land surface temperature datasets is important for capturing spatiotemporal variations, which are crucial for regional climate and drought studies. Methods that improve their reliability include using a combination of MODIS data and meteorological station data to reconstruct temperatures in cloud-covered areas and employing regression models to refine the dataset's accuracy.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 土地表面温度数据集的重建对于捕捉时空变化至关重要，这对区域气候和干旱研究具有重要意义。提高其可靠性的方法包括结合MODIS数据和气象站数据，以重建云覆盖区域的温度，并采用回归模型来提高数据集的准确性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I am unsure about how data collection methods address the significant cloud cover issues affecting satellite-derived land surface temperature measurements.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定数据收集方法如何解决影响卫星获取的地表温度测量的显著云层覆盖问题。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data collection methods involve using a reconstruction model that integrates MODIS daily and monthly data with meteorological station data to tackle cloud cover issues. This approach helps reconstruct land surface temperature in cloud-covered areas and improves data quality by addressing errors.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法涉及使用重建模型，将MODIS日常和月度数据与气象站数据结合，以解决云覆盖问题。这种方法有助于重建云覆盖区域的地表温度，并通过解决错误来提高数据质量。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how combining different data sources can enhance the accuracy of land surface temperature datasets.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白结合不同数据源如何能提高地表温度数据集的准确性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Combining MODIS data with meteorological station data allows for the reconstruction of more accurate land surface temperature datasets by overcoming cloud cover limitations. The integration of these data sources enables the creation of a regression analysis model, improving accuracy and consistency with in situ observations.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 结合MODIS数据和气象站数据可以克服云层覆盖的限制，从而重建更准确的地表温度数据集。这些数据源的整合使得可以创建回归分析模型，提高了与现场观测的一致性和准确性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe the challenges involved in collecting accurate land surface temperature data and how these challenges can be addressed using a reconstruction model.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 收集准确的地表温度数据面临的挑战包括：数据缺失、传感器误差、空间和时间分辨率不足、气象条件的影响以及地表特征的多样性等。这些挑战可以通过使用重建模型来解决。重建模型能够利用已有的数据和信息，填补缺失值，校正传感器误差，并通过空间插值和时间序列分析提高数据的分辨率，从而提供更准确的地表温度估计。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: One of the main challenges in collecting accurate land surface temperature (LST) data is the presence of clouds, which cover more than 60% of the global surface daily, leading to missing and low-quality values in satellite-based LST data. This can be addressed using a reconstruction model that integrates MODIS daily and monthly data with meteorological station data to reconstruct LST in areas affected by cloud coverage and for grid cells with high LST error. Further accuracy can be enhanced by implementing a regression analysis model.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 收集准确的地表温度（LST）数据面临的主要挑战之一是云层的存在，云层每天覆盖全球表面超过60%，导致卫星基于LST数据的缺失和低质量值。这可以通过使用重建模型来解决，该模型将MODIS的日数据和月数据与气象站数据结合，以重建受云层覆盖影响的区域的LST，以及高LST误差的网格单元。通过实施回归分析模型，可以进一步提高准确性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the data collection methods used to create a comprehensive land surface temperature dataset that accounts for spatial and temporal variations.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨用于创建一个全面的地表温度数据集的数据收集方法，该数据集考虑了空间和时间的变化。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods used include a combination of MODIS (Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer) daily data, monthly data, and meteorological station data. This approach leverages satellite thermal infrared instruments for detailed spatialized surfaces and near-real-time data access, as well as the high reliability and long time series advantages of meteorological stations. The integration of these data sources through a reconstruction model allows for the generation of a comprehensive LST dataset with monthly temporal resolution that accounts for spatial and temporal variations.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法包括结合MODIS（中分辨率成像光谱仪）日数据、月数据和气象站数据。这种方法利用卫星热红外仪器提供详细的空间表面和近实时数据访问，以及气象站的高可靠性和长期时间序列优势。通过重建模型整合这些数据源，可以生成一个具有月度时间分辨率的综合地表温度（LST）数据集，考虑了空间和时间的变化。
